goals.question: What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of bird strikes per year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the trend of bird strikes over the years and identify any patterns or anomalies.

goals.question: Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of bird species and their strike counts
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common bird species involved in bird strikes and prioritize measures to mitigate their impact.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of bird strikes by time of day
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the time of day when bird strikes are most likely to occur and take preventive measures accordingly.

goals.question: What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of bird strikes by aircraft type
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand which aircraft types are most vulnerable to bird strikes and take appropriate measures to reduce their risk.

goals.question: What is the cost of damage caused by bird strikes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of cost of damage by year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the financial impact of bird strikes and prioritize measures to reduce their cost.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Incident Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Incident Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Incident Date'])]
    data['Year'] = data['Incident Date'].dt.year
    yearly_birdstrikes = data.groupby('Year').size()
    
    plt.plot(yearly_birdstrikes.index, yearly_birdstrikes.values)
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency of Bird Strikes')
    plt.title('What is the frequency of bird strikes per year?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    species_counts = data['Species Name'].value_counts()
    species_counts = species_counts.head(10)
    
    ax = species_counts.plot(kind='bar', color='tab:blue')
    plt.title('Which bird species is responsible for the most strikes?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Bird Species')
    plt.ylabel('Strike Counts')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    max_species = species_counts.idxmax()
    max_count = species_counts.max()
    plt.axhline(y=max_count, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Max: {max_species} ({max_count:.2f})')
    plt.legend()
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['time_of_day'] = pd.to_datetime(data['time_of_day'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['time_of_day'])]
    data['hour'] = data['time_of_day'].dt.hour

    hour_counts = data['hour'].value_counts().sort_index()
    hour_counts.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)

    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by time of day?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Hour of the Day')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Bird Strikes')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.legend(['Bird Strikes'])

    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    aircraft_counts = data['Aircraft_Type'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(aircraft_counts, labels=aircraft_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of bird strikes by aircraft type?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend(aircraft_counts.index, title="Aircraft Types", loc="best")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Incident Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Incident Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Incident Date'])]
    data['Year'] = data['Incident Date'].dt.year
    data['Cost'] = data['Cost Index'].astype(float)
    
    yearly_cost = data.groupby('Year')['Cost'].sum().reset_index()
    
    plt.bar(yearly_cost['Year'], yearly_cost['Cost'])
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Cost of Damage')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the cost of damage caused by bird strikes?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
